title: How to Make Vegetable Manchurian

parts.name: Making the dumplings or Manchurian balls

steps.headline: Finely grate vegetables.
steps.description: These might include carrots and cabbage, and some grated cauliflower and French beans. Add chopped capsicum if you like its taste.

steps.headline: Chop the green chili and the garlic cloves.
Decide how to use the vegetables.
steps.description: You can either boil the vegetables or use them raw. Just make sure that they are grated or chopped finely.

steps.headline: Prepare the vegetables in a bowl.
steps.description: Add a pinch of salt. Squeeze and drain out the vegetables to get some vegetable stock.

steps.headline: Add cornflour and some cooked rice for binding to the vegetable mixture.
Add a teaspoon of soy sauce and a little pepper powder.
Add very little water to this mixture and make lemon sized balls or dumplings.
Add oil in a wok or pan.
Deep fry these Manchurian balls for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown.
In a wok or pan, add the 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of sesame oil or other refined oil.
Add the chopped ginger, chopped cloves of garlic, and chopped green chillies.
steps.description: Stir fry them for a few seconds.

steps.headline: Add the soy sauce, tomato ketchup, green chilli paste or sauce, and vinegar.
Add 2 to 3 cups of vegetable stock or water.
Take 1-2 tablespoons of cornflour separately and add some water to it so that it is of a paste like consistency.
steps.description: Add this mixture slowly to the gravy in the wok and keep stirring to avoid lumps.

steps.headline: Add one teaspoon or more of sugar to the gravy to balance the sourness of gravy.
Add chopped greens of spring onions and the Manchurian balls.
Bring the gravy to boil for about a minute.
Serve.
steps.description: The tasty vegetable Manchurian is ready!

text: Making the dumplings or Manchurian balls Finely grate vegetables. These might include carrots and cabbage, and some grated cauliflower and French beans. Add chopped capsicum if you like its taste. Chop the green chili and the garlic cloves.  Decide how to use the vegetables. You can either boil the vegetables or use them raw. Just make sure that they are grated or chopped finely. Prepare the vegetables in a bowl. Add a pinch of salt. Squeeze and drain out the vegetables to get some vegetable stock. Add cornflour and some cooked rice for binding to the vegetable mixture.  Add a teaspoon of soy sauce and a little pepper powder.  Add very little water to this mixture and make lemon sized balls or dumplings.  Add oil in a wok or pan.  Deep fry these Manchurian balls for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown.  Making the gravy sauce In a wok or pan, add the 2 tablespoons (29.6 ml) of sesame oil or other refined oil.  Add the chopped ginger, chopped cloves of garlic, and chopped green chillies. Stir fry them for a few seconds. Add the soy sauce, tomato ketchup, green chilli paste or sauce, and vinegar.  Add 2 to 3 cups of vegetable stock or water.  Take 1-2 tablespoons of cornflour separately and add some water to it so that it is of a paste like consistency. Add this mixture slowly to the gravy in the wok and keep stirring to avoid lumps. Add one teaspoon or more of sugar to the gravy to balance the sourness of gravy. Add salt to taste. Add chopped greens of spring onions and the Manchurian balls.  Bring the gravy to boil for about a minute.  Serve. The tasty vegetable Manchurian is ready!
